system.description:
Vulpus Traits

Characters with the vulpus heritage share a variety of traits in common with one another.

Age. Vulpus age and mature at a similar rate to humans.

Size.  Vulpus are typically lithe and lean. They rarely exceed 6 feet tall and typically weigh anywhere between 110–130 pounds. Your size is Medium.

Speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

Agile Fingers. You gain proficiency in Sleight of Hand and an expertise die to checks made to pickpocket or otherwise conceal your hand motions.

Divine Trickster. Choose either the thaumaturgy or spare the dying cantrip. This spell does not count against the number of spells you know.

Shrewd Student. You’re a quick learner, and you’ve mastered the ability to pick up tidbits of knowledge along the way. You gain two specialties in lore skills of your choice, plus an additional one whenever your proficiency bonus increases. This is in addition to those you would normally gain from your level and Intelligence modifier.

Vulpus Gifts

In addition to the traits found in your vulpus heritage, select one of the following gifts.

Escape Artist

Your ability to get out of compromising situations is unmatched. You may Disengage as a bonus action. Additionally, you have advantage on checks made to escape grapples or traps and spells that restrict your movement, such as snares or the web spell.

Fox Fire

You have an innate connection to fire. You learn the produce flame cantrip. At 3rd level you may cast faerie fire once per long rest. At 5th level, you may cast scorching ray once per long rest. These do not count against the spells you know, and your spellcasting ability modifier for them is either Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, whichever is highest.

Quick Wits

You’re adept at thinking on your feet. You gain a bonus to your initiative score equal to your Intelligence modifier. Additionally, when you make an attack against a creature that has not taken its first turn in the initiative order, add 1d4 to the attack roll.

Vulpus Paragon

When you reach 10th level, you become a better vulpus and gain one paragon gift from the following list.

Psychopomp

You tap into your innate connection to the afterlife, enabling you to communicate with the departed. You learn the spell speak with dead and it does not count against the number of spells you know.
Additionally, your affinity with the afterlife empowers your connection with the soul you are speaking to. When you cast this spell, you may ask one additional question of the corpse before it de-animates.

Shapeshifter

Your penchant for trickery and deceit manifests physically. Once per long rest, you are able to change into another form. This body must be humanoid, though it does not have to be someone that you have seen before. You retain all of your statistics while in this form, and any Deception checks you make to impersonate another person gains an expertise die. This change lasts for a number of hours equal to your Constitution modifier, until you take damage, or if you voluntarily choose to end the effect.

Wreathed in Flame

Your natural connection to fire intensifies, coming to your defense when you are in danger. You learn the fire shield spell and always cast it as the warm shield option. Once per long rest, you may cast this spell without expending material components or a spell slot.
